productList.productName: Synology DiskStation DS415+ 4-Bay NAS Server
productList.productDescription:
PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS



  • Synology DiskStation Manager OS

  • 4 x 3.5" or 2.5" SATA III Drive Bays

  • 2.4 GHz Intel Atom Quad-Core CPU

  • 2GB DDR3 RAM

  • Read Speed: 228 MB/s, Write: 233 MB/s

  • 2 x Gigabit Ethernet

  • USB 3.0 / USB 2.0 / eSATA Interface

  • RAID 0, 1, 5, 6, 10, JBOD

  • iSCSI And Virtualization Ready

  • Complete LDAP, Link Aggregation Support


The Synology DiskStation DS412+ 4-Bay All-In-1 NAS Server For SMB Users is specially engineered for small- to medium-sized businesses requiring a high-performance, easily-managed and full-featured NAS (Network Attached Storage) solution. The DiskStation centralizes data backups, safeguards vital assets and shares files across various platforms.



The DS412+ enables fast transfer speeds of approximately 205MB/s read and 183MB/s write when using a RAID 5 configuration in a Windows-based environment, with link aggregation enabled. It's equipped with 2 LAN with failover and link aggregation support, which, combined with a convenient hot-swappable hard drive design, ensures continual service uptime in the event that the drives require replacement or LAN fails unexpectedly. The DiskStation features blazing-fast USB 3.0 connectivity, offering transmission speeds of up to 5Gbps.

CPU Passive Cooling Technology and System Fan Redundancy work to prevent overheating, in order to keep the DS412+ running optimally. This also allows the system to avoid reliance on a dedicated processor cooling fan and mitigate critical points of failure. When the system detects fan failures, the integrated redundancy mechanism spins up the functional fan, giving proper ventilation to the system, while supporting continued operations until your replacement fan is in position. Thus, system damage is minimized, while availability is maximized.

Synology's Hybrid RAID (SHR) automatically constructs an optimal RAID volume with data protection based on the hard drives installed, so you need not have hard drives of identical size. The SHR still provides a manual setup option for advanced users. Multiple Volumes on RAID enables you to generate numerous volumes on a RAID structure, giving you a versatile and efficient way to manage your storage across all available drives. Should the need arise to expand your volumes, just allocate additional storage space on the UI and DSM will take care of the rest for you--without any service disruption.

The system runs on Synology DiskStation Manager (DSM), delivering comprehensive applications and features targeted at office and business workgroups. Web Station with PHP / MySQL support permits one Synology DS412+ to host as many as 30 websites, as well as multiple 3rd party web applications, including Content Management, Customer Relationship Management and e-Commerce systems.

The integrated mail server transforms Synology DS412+ into a dedicated mail service provider, while the add-on package, Mail Station 2, offers a webmail interface for users to access emails stored on Synology DS412+. Synology Surveillance Station provides a centralized interface from which to control IP cameras deployed in your office or home, giving you the freedom to travel miles away and still watch live views, record events, and capture snapshots with a computer or mobile device.

A slew of add-on packages enables the Synology DS412+ to replace multiple pieces of network hardware. The VPN Server provides a simple VPN solution that turns your Synology DS412+ into a VPN server, giving you a safe way to connect to a private LAN at a remote site. Directory Server lets Synology DS412+ host LDAP service with centralized access control, authentication, and account management, further boosting your office management efficiency.

Enjoy Windows ADS and ACL support. ADS integration permits Synology DS412+ to quickly and easily fit in an existing business network environment without requiring a recreation of users' accounts on the Synology DS412+. The User Home feature reduces the amount of effort required for administrators to create a private shared folder for a large number of users. ACL support offers much finer-grained access control and efficient privilege settings, enabling IT staff to set up privileges to files and folders on DS412+ via their familiar Windows user interface. The privileges will be applied to all access entries, including AFP, FTP, File Station, NFS and WebDAV. The secure privilege gives IT staff peace of mind, eliminating worry about loopholes.

Additionally, the iSCSI support in DiskStation Manager (DSM) allows the DS412+ to offer seamless storage solutions for virtualization servers, including VMware, Citrix, and Microsoft Hyper-V. This is a perfect alternative to a SAN business solution. Not only efficient but also affordable, the iSCSI enables SMB users to consolidate storage into data center arrays while giving hosts the appearance of locally-attached disks.

Designed to make efficient use of resources, the DS412+ boasts a low operating power consumption of a mere 44W. Offering dual 3.62 x 3.62" (92 x 92mm) fans, plus smart airflow to keep the system running cool all the time. In addition, the noise-dampening design makes the device whisper-quiet compared to PC counterparts. As if this weren't enough, the DS412+ also supports Wake on LAN / WAN, multiple scheduled power on / off and hard drive hibernation to further minimize power consumption and operation costs. Like all Synology products, this NAS server is produced with RoHS compliant parts, reflecting Synology's commitment to the preservation and protection of the environment.


Note: Read and write speeds may vary in different environments



High-Performance Data Throughput



DS412+ enables fast transfer speeds of approximately 205MB/s read and 183MB/s write when using a RAID 5 configuration in a Windows-based environment, with link aggregation enabled. It's equipped with 2 LAN with failover and link aggregation support, which, combined with a convenient hot-swappable hard drive design, ensures continual service uptime in the event that the drives require replacement or LAN fails unexpectedly. The DiskStation features blazing-fast USB 3.0 connectivity, offering transmission speeds of up to 5Gbps


Dependable and Reliable



CPU Passive Cooling Technology and System Fan Redundancy work to prevent overheating, in order to keep the DS412+ running optimally. This also allows the system to avoid reliance on a dedicated processor cooling fan and mitigate critical points of failure. When the system detects fan failures, the integrated redundancy mechanism spins up the functional fan, giving proper ventilation to the system, while supporting continued operations until your replacement fan is in position. Thus, system damage is minimized, while availability is maximized.


Flexible Storage Management



Synology's Hybrid RAID (SHR) automatically constructs an optimal RAID volume with data protection based on the hard drives installed, so you need not have hard drives of identical size. SHR divides each drive into smaller chunks, producing extra redundant storage--enabling use of the maximum capacity of each disk. The SHR still provides a manual setup option for advanced users. Multiple Volumes on RAID enables you to generate numerous volumes on a RAID structure, giving you a versatile and efficient way to manage your storage across all available drives. Should the need arise to expand your volumes, just allocate additional storage space on the UI and DSM will take care of the rest for you--without any service disruption



Another plus is that you need not wait for volume setup to be finished before storing data in the NAS server; start moving data into the DiskStation during the volume creation process



Depending upon your choice, SHR provides 1-2 hard disks fault-tolerance of data protection. Even if one of your hard disks fails to function properly, your data is still accessible and safe


Rich Business Applications



The system runs on Synology DiskStation Manager (DSM), delivering comprehensive applications and features targeted at office and business workgroups. Web Station with PHP / MySQL support permits one Synology DS412+ to host as many as 30 websites, as well as multiple 3rd party web applications, including Content Management, Customer Relationship Management and e-Commerce systems



The integrated mail server transforms Synology DS412+ into a dedicated mail service provider, while the add-on package, Mail Station 2, offers a webmail interface for users to access emails stored on Synology DS412+. Synology Surveillance Station provides a centralized interface from which to control IP cameras deployed in your office or home, giving you the freedom to travel miles away and still watch live views, record events, and capture snapshots with a computer or mobile device



A slew of add-on packages enables the Synology DS412+ to replace multiple pieces of network hardware. The VPN Server provides a simple VPN solution that turns your Synology DS412+ into a VPN server, giving you a safe way to connect to a private LAN at a remote site. Directory Server lets Synology DS412+ host LDAP service with centralized access control, authentication, and account management, further boosting your office management efficiency


Fit to Business Environment



Enjoy Windows ADS and ACL support. ADS integration permits Synology DS412+ to quickly and easily fit in an existing business network environment without requiring a recreation of users' accounts on the Synology DS412+. The User Home feature reduces the amount of effort required for administrators to create a private shared folder for a large number of users. ACL support offers much finer-grained access control and efficient privilege settings, enabling IT staff to set up privileges to files and folders on DS412+ via their familiar Windows user interface. The privileges will be applied to all access entries, including AFP, FTP, File Station, NFS and WebDAV. The secure privilege gives IT staff peace of mind, eliminating worry about loopholes.


iSCSI and Virtualization Ready



Additionally, the iSCSI support in DiskStation Manager (DSM) allows the DS412+ to offer seamless storage solutions for virtualization servers, including VMware, Citrix, and Microsoft Hyper-V. This is a perfect alternative to a SAN business solution. Not only efficient but also affordable, the iSCSI enables SMB users to consolidate storage into data center arrays while giving hosts the appearance of locally-attached disks.



With Storage Manager, you can monitor storage space and manage volumes on DiskStation. Easily create a volume based on any RAID type, or multiple ones on a single RAID. If the need arises, you can also expand your volume with ease. Storage Manager is an intuitive and easy-to-use application for your business storage space



Using S.M.A.R.T testing can aid you in identifying reliability indicators and anticipating potential hard disk failures


Configuration Backup



Backup Your System Settings

Synology's Backup & Restore not only enables you to easily back up data, but also gives you the ability to back up your system configurations in Control Panel - user group, shared folder, domain, file sharing, and other services such as password strength and settings are accessible on the home folder. Backing up system configurations helps your business ease the burden during large-scale system migration or restoration



Automatic Backup

It's not enough to just back up your system configurations once. Businesses are constantly evolving, as are the configurations - employee relocation, new projects, and new teams. Synology's configuration backup enables your business to schedule each backup task so that whenever you make a change, it gets recorded. Depending upon how frequently you modify your system-wide settings, configuration backup can always conform to your schedule



Customize Restoration

Whenever you need to back up, you need to restore. Synology's configuration backup permits businesses to restore system configurations at 3 levels. Choose to restore all system configurations whenever there is a major system upgrade or migration, or opt to restore just the category of "Users, Groups, and Shared Folders" configurations if the alterations made concern the employees and their privileges. If the changes are very specific, you may also restore without affecting other settings


Anti-Virus



Antivirus for Your NAS

Available in Package Center, Antivirus Essential is a free application that safeguards your Synology DiskStation against all potential virus threats. A full-fledged shield with features such as live update, quarantine zone, schedule scan and event log, it has the ability to locate and eliminate viruses hidden in multiple layers of zipped files



Ready to Scan

Antivirus Essential boasts 3 scan modes: Full, custom and system scan. A Full Scan runs a server-wide check on system, data and files. Custom Scan lets you choose different folders to scan. System Scan checks the system partition and is especially handy when you want to check for system health without running a full scan on all files. Schedule any type of scan with the frequency that suits you



Quarantine, Report & Update

When viruses are caught, they're automatically relocated to the quarantine zone to prevent them from affecting DiskStation. When you think the system is wrong about a certain quarantined file, you have the ability to restore it and add it to the white list. A built-in report provides a clear idea of what's going on. Live update offers information on the latest virus definitions, ensuring that none slip through undetected


LDAP



Complete LDAP Support

Synology offers comprehensive LDAP directory service support, enabling businesses to host their own LDAP server for centralization of network resources and accounts. Alternatively, join DiskStation to an existing LDAP domain as a client. To comply with business integrity, easily set up privileges for LDAP domain users and groups, and set their rights to access applications and services. LDAP service can be hosted via installation of Directory Server in Package Center



Hosting Your Own LDAP Server

Centralized directory service management is safer and more efficient. Businesses can join their other network devices to LDAP domain and utilize DiskStation as command center to manage user accounts and offer authentication. Setup is easy - simply install Directory Server in Package Center and your DiskStation can turn into an LDAP server in just a few clicks. Now, your employees can use one account to access DiskStation, as well as additional LDAP-capable clients, including Mac and Linux-based devices



Joining an LDAP Directory Service

You have the ability to join Synology DiskStation to your LDAP directory service, substantially increasing IT management productivity by minimizing the time needed to individually setup new accounts. Users in the LDAP domain can use their account to log into DiskStation and take advantage of its services



Privilege Management

IT administrator can easily set up privileges for domain users and groups to DiskStation resources, including shared folders, space quota and applications. Plus, set storage quota for a group or user account to keep storage capacity in check. Access rights to various DiskStation applications, like File Station, Surveillance Station, Network Backup and more, are also supported


Internet Connection



The All-In-One DiskStation

Getting DiskStation to connect to the Internet is no sweat. Synology DiskStation supports all types of connections and web essentials to suit your particular requirements. Connect via PPPoE through your broadband modem, via a router, or by wireless dongle. Synology's ezCloud service enables you to register your own Synology domain name



DDNS Service

With Synology's ezCloud DDNS service, you can register a domain name for your business. This way, you can connect to DiskStation with a simple URL of your own choosing, instead of IP address. As an IT staff member, you can check DiskStation's DDNS status and information via MyDS Center. And there are more DDNS domain services where that came from



By PPPoE

Does your business use PPPoE connection provided by your Internet Service Provider (ISP)? Just connect DiskStation to DSL or cable modem and input account name and password to obtain connection directly to the web--without using a router



By Router

Router Configuration on DSM's Control Panel enables you to choose router you are using and set up your own port forwarding regulations. If router is UPnP capable, DSM can automatically discover it in network. From there, it's just a few clicks to get everything set up



By Wireless Dongle

Synology DiskStation supports a plethora of USB wireless dongles, including models from AboCom, AirLink, ALFA, Amped, ARGtek, Asus, AZIO, Belkin, Buffalo, CERIO, Cisco, CNet, ConnectLand, ConnectGear, Corega, D-Link, DrayTek, EDIMAX, ENCORE, EnGenius, Hawking, IBT, INTELLINET, IOGear, KEEBOX, LevelOne, LG, Loopcomm, MOMOPRICE, Netgear, Netis, Patriot, PCI, PremierTek, Proxim, Rosewill, Sapido, SMC, Sony, Sparklan, Tenda, TOTOLINK, TP-Link, TRENDNET, Zinwell, Zonet, and Zyxel. Just connect the dongle to DiskStation to get immediate Internet access in wireless environment. Join a Wi-Fi network or access an ad-hoc network.



Link Aggregation Support

The way to address 2 problems with Ethernet connections: Bandwidth limitations and lack of resilience. As bandwidth has non-linear scaling, the only way without jumping to next generation is to connect 2 Ethernet links via channel bonding - Synology utilizes 802.3ad Dynamic Link Aggregation standard to provide double the speed. Another mode, network fault tolerance, automatically kicks in when 1 LAN connection fails; the other gets switched on to maintain server operation. The following switches have been tested and verified compatible: 3com 4200G and HP Procurve Switch 2824 for IEEE 802.3ad; and Corega CG-SW05GTPLB, D-Link DGS-1005D, D-Link DES-1008, D-Link DSS-24+ and Dell Power connect 2508 for Non-IEEE 802.3ad (ALB)


Server Management



Auto DSM Update

DSM Update in Control Panel checks your DSM version and lets you update through the web. You can allow regular check-up for DSM update to function behind the screen. When there's an update for your DiskStation, it will be downloaded and you'll get a notification on your desktop when it's ready for installation



Smart System Migration

Helps minimize your panic level by providing smooth and no-sweat system migration. All you need do is remove the hard disks and insert them into an identical DiskStation, run the initial setup process again, and voila - all your data and server settings will be recovered right away



HDD S.M.A.R.T.

Self-Monitoring Analysis and Reporting Technology (S.M.A.R.T) is a monitoring system for computer hard drives that examines and reports on various attributes to alert you to potential disk failures. You can check disk information, disk S.M.A.R.T. information, and perform S.M.A.R.T. tests. It's now easy to anticipate failures and replace hard disks to ensure that you don't fall victim to storage outage



Monitor Resource Usage

DSM offers a pair of handy tools for IT administrators to monitor resource usage status of DiskStation. The Resource Monitor permits you to view a graphical display of DiskStation's usage on CPU, memory, volume and network flow. SNMP protocol support lets you monitor DiskStation via existing network management software



Be the Connection Manager

Connection Manager provides IT administrator with a bird's eye view of DiskStation's present connections. Keep tabs on who is connected, where the connection is coming from, or duration of connection. Administrators can take action against a suspicious connection by disconnecting or disabling the account entirely. Connection Manager currently supports service connection from DSM, FTP, SMB and AFP



Logs

Every move users make gets recorded into a Log. On DSM, you can see logs for system status, connections, FTP transfer, File Station, WebDAV, backup, or Windows file service transfer. Additionally, logs may be deleted or saved for later use. When archiving logs reach the space limit, the oldest record gets removed to save space



Built-in Telnet and SSH Support

DiskStation is Telnet and SSH-ready. Enable Telnet / SSH service on DiskStation and remotely log in via Telnet / SSH. Designed especially for users with solid grasp of Linux



UPS

Connect an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) to DiskStation to prevent data loss due to unexpected power failure. DSM also permits multiple Synology DiskStations in same network to share a single UPS. One UPS is all you need to safeguard your servers within network


DS Finder



Finding Needle in a Haystack

Don't know which DiskStation is causing trouble? DS finder is a handy gadget that enables you to immediately pinpoint the errant DiskStation with a red flag. Log into the DiskStation via DS finder, tap the "Find Me" button, and the built-in buzzer aids you in locating the one server you seek. Finding that needle in a haystack is now not only possible, but easy!



A Neat Tool for the IT Staff

In a business office, DS finder enables your IT staff to monitor status of any DiskStation via mobile devices. Search for all available DiskStations within network, and monitor crucial information like storage usage, operating time, thermal, HDD and network status, and more. Whenever something is up, you can e-mail status report to colleagues for fast examination. With secured HTTPS support on mobile devices, monitoring becomes a whole lot safer for you



Rise Up, or Go to Sleep

Power DiskStation on or off via the DS finder. You need not walk in front of the server, nor do you have to sit in front of a computer to power off. A tap on DS finder is all that's required. If DiskStation supports Wake on LAN (WOL), DS finder affords the freedom to turn on DiskStation whenever you need it



Push Notifications

DS finder automatically tracks things down for you. Besides SMS and e-mail, DS finder supports Push Notifications on iOS devices. Any time something is triggered, the message will be pushed to your device in just seconds. In category of system, internal storage, backup and restore, power supply, USBCopy and external storage, there are 66 different types of events to select. Anything can be detected, and nothing will be missed



Quick Download

DS finder runs on iPad / iPhone / iPod touch and Android devices. It's available for free on Apple's App Store or Google Play


Apps On-Demand



Web-Based Platform

Enjoy the freedom to select the service you wish to use and install the corresponding apps, only when necessary. Choose from Photo Station, Download Station, Cloud Station and other web apps to install from Package Center. Complete customization affords greater control over your network storage



Easy Maintenance

Apps as packages not only makes for customized installation, but indicates that updates are available more quickly. Whenever Synology rolls out a new product, you get the update instantly and can install it immediately via Package Center



3rd-Party Applications

Synology continues to extend support to 3rd party applications to quickly increase its database. These applications further increase the size of your application repertoire to help you when working with the services provided by the DiskStation. Here's the full list of supported applications: LifeType, nucleuscms, Serendipity, simplePHPblog and Wordpress for Blog System apps; Discuz!, MyBB, phpBB and PHPWind for Bulletin Board apps; Drupal, Joomla!, TYPO3, Xoops, Zimplit and Vanilla for Content Management; SugarCRM and VtigerCRM for Customer Relationship Management; phpMyAdmin and SQL Buddy for Database Management; OpenCart, osCommerce, Zen Cart and Magento for E-Commerce; Claroline, moodle, Atutor and Dokeos for E-Learning; Gallery, ZenPHOTO, and Coppermine for Gallery; eTicket and osTicket for Ticket System; and MediaWiki, WebCollab and WebCalendar for Wiki and Groupware



Additional Apps

Download and install a variety of apps tailored to your specific needs. Whether you want to share files via the cloud or photos in an online album, set up VPN environments or antivirus to protect your system, Synology's Package Center enables you to do it all in a matter of a few simple clicks


File Station



The Ultimate App for Your Files

Available in Package Center, File Station helps you manage all files stored on DiskStation, via HTTPS protected web browser. In between your PC and DiskStation, you can easily generate new folders, upload and download files, and copy, rename and delete files. For businesses, File Station offers support for Google Docs, Windows ACL, VLC player and many more



Drag-n-Drop

HTML5 web technology lets you drag and drop documents from PC to File Station with ease. To move or copy a file within DiskStation, all you need do is drag it from 1 folder to another. Use it on all types of files, including work documents, sales report spreadsheets, and marketing materials. You can also drag a file to create a shortcut on DSM desktop.



Integrated Search Engine

Advanced Search feature offers numerous options to narrow and focus your search and save you more time. Simply type in the keyword and choose from file type, last modified date, location, size or owner of the file to narrow search. The search is optimized largely due to an integrated indexing system. Like the index in the back of a book, it makes crawling through a massive database quicker and more efficient



User Privileges & Windows ACL

Manage user and group access rights on any shared folder directly within File Station. When you create a shared folder, you can set up privilege controls in a streamlined way. Plus, administrators can define more fine-grained, file-based privilege settings via Windows ACL right in File Station. Using the Permission Editor, all 13 advanced options are easily checked off to provide the integrity level your business requires



Google Docs Support

Even without Office applications, you can still preview documents on your DiskStation via Google Docs support. Every format supported by Google Docs may be opened in File Station, including Adobe PDF, PowerPoint, Word, Excel and more


Cloud Station For Windows PC's



Automatic Sync

Whether you are at home or enjoying the outdoors, your computer always houses important files with the latest versions in a single folder. To that end, Cloud Station does the work for you. It may resemble any other folder on your PC, but the Cloud Station folder is really a private cloud that's always up-to-date. It pushes files, songs, and photos to any computer you're working on and automatically syncs



Offline Viewing

View and edit files anytime you like with the Cloud Station folder--even without an Internet connection! Edit spreadsheets, create new documents, or upload photos, all within the offline folder. When web access is resumed, all changes are automatically synced onto Cloud Station and ready again for the next offline viewing



Everybody's Cloud

A single Synology NAS serves as everyone's private cloud. Every user enjoys the ability to own a Cloud Station folder on his or her own computer and reap all the benefits it has to offer. When your PC and DiskStation are in the same local area network (LAN), you also gain the ability to enjoy faster transfer rates than those offered over the web. Large file uploading and syncing have just become faster


Synology ezCloud



QuickConnect Service

Even in the absence of network settings, you still retain remote access to your files. With Synology's ezCloud, you can retrieve anything over the Internet. Once the network cable is connected to your DiskStation, utilize Cloud Station and DS file to access and sync files. You need not configure a router or any other network device. Wherever you are, your files are always accessible 1



Personal DDNS

Manage the online presence of your cloud via Synology's DDNS service. Free and reliable, ezCloud enables you to directly register a personalized domain name from Synology. You can also monitor your DiskStation online for troubleshooting. Log into the MyDS Center webpage to view the status of your registered Synology NAS instantly



Stay Connected with Notifications

Get notification concerning the status of your DiskStation via multiple channels. On the top of SMS and email notifications, Synology offers free push services on Skype, Windows Live Messenger, and DS finder on iOS devices, Android phones, and Windows phones. Decide which events to trigger notifications, in order to avoid unnecessary alerts. Event categories can be set precisely for you, so you can take appropriate action as needed


Energy Efficient Design



Designed to make efficient use of resources, the DS412+ boasts low operating power consumption of a mere 44W. Offering dual 3.62 x 3.62" (92 x 92mm) fans, plus smart airflow to keep the system running cool all the time. In addition, the noise-dampening design makes the device whisper-quiet compared to PC counterparts. As if this weren't enough, the DS412+ also supports Wake on LAN / WAN, multiple scheduled power on / off and hard drive hibernation to further minimize power consumption and operation costs. Like all Synology products, this NAS server is produced with RoHS compliant parts, reflecting Synology's commitment to the preservation and protection of the environment


User Interface


Full Customization



Customize Login Page

Customize login page with a personal touch. For businesses that wish to display their logo on the login page, Synology offers them the option to do so. Login page background and panel design also customizable



Personalize Desktop Wallpaper

What good is a desktop if you can't change wallpaper? Synology provides several choices to help you begin. Also, you have the ability to use an image of your own to make it look and feel unique and personalized



Arrange Shortcuts on Desktop

There are a number of ways to use a DiskStation. Yet there are always some apps that you use more frequently. There may also be a folder containing files that you constantly refer to. Generate shortcuts and access them directly, right on the desktop. If you find the desktop becomes cluttered with an excess of shortcuts, you can also arrange them into groups or utilize other desktop management tools (discussed in more depth below)



Install Packages That You Need

Besides essential functions such as Storage Manager, discover more ways to use DiskStation in Package Center. Enjoy the freedom to choose the packages you want. For certain popular applications, like Audio Station and Surveillance Station, the packages come with individual login pages. Just assign an alias and access it directly from a stand-alone login page


Desktop Management Tools



Web Desktop

DiskStation Manger provides a complete desktop on-web with customizable settings, making software personalization a reality. The desktop is not only customizable, but offers a suite of management tools to help you keep track of server status



Instant View on Task Bar

Instant Preview is a huge help when you have a great many windows open and start to get overwhelmed or confused. Mouse over one of the icons on your DSM taskbar and you will see a thumbnail preview of the window or any other app you have running. Click the thumbnail preview to once again view in full screen



Click to Show Desktop

Having too many programs running simultaneously can result in a chaotic, difficult-to-manage desktop. What you need is the Show Desktop button in the upper-left corner to clear the screen. Although the desktop is swiped clean, applications continue running in the background. To restore immediate access to them in the order they were opened, use the same button



Pilot View Desktop Status

With a single click, all your currently running apps are viewable in one place. While multitasking, you can rapidly locate the one task you seek



Server Status Summarized on Desktop Widget

You always want to keep an eye on system status. DSM 4.0 makes that a quick and easy process you can perform with one click. Using the new widgets, you can monitor all types of things, including system health, logs, backup status, storage and resource usage, plus active connections, all in one place. If you want to launch a relevant app, simply click on the icon and the widget is updated instantly


Multitasking



Switch Between Applications Instantly

DSM enables you to run multiple applications and place them on task bar simultaneously. Simply click the app icon on task bar to restore your favorite application, and click another to switch to it instantly. You need not wait for the web page to reload anymore



Resume Your Work

All running applications are placed on taskbar and are not shut-off when you switch to another application. You're just a click away from being back on track where you left off



Perform Tasks in the Background

You may need hours to upload, copy or move favorite movie collections on DiskStation from one volume to another. With File Station, you can listen to music on Audio Station or keep working on whatever you wish while upload tasks or any other file operations are queued and executed in the background. Closing File Station window does not affect the background tasks in any way. Waiting is no longer a necessary evil in DSM!
productList.productMetaDescription: The Synology DiskStation DS415+ 4-Bay NAS Server makes a great group gift idea for any small business owner, or for any household that has digital storage needs.
